event: Here is the table of events and timestamps:
admitted to the pediatric intensive care unit
severely impaired left ventricular ejection fraction
sinus tachycardia with incomplete right bundle branch block
N-terminal prohormone of brain natriuretic peptide (NT-proBNP)
cannulation of the left femoral artery and vein
13 Fr/15 cm arterial and 21 Fr/55 cm venous HLS Cannula
Cardiohelp System with a 7.0 HLS Set Advanced Bioline Coating
blood flow of 3.3 l/min at 3800 rpm
acute ischemic injury of the non-cannulated leg
insufficient blood inflow due to low cardiac output
Dacron conduit was sewed on the right femoral artery
ECBF could be enhanced to 4–5 l/min
MAP could be maintained at 40–50 torr
venous drainage pressures could be reduced
sufficient preload within the right atrium and vena cava
inspiratory oxygen fraction of the respirator was increased
arterial oxygen partial pressure in blood drawn from the right radial artery was normal
MAP rose from a nadir of 30 torr
cerebral oximetry by near infrared spectroscopy
target partial thrombin time of 60–80 s
all microbial specimens collected remained negative
ECMO cannulas in the left femoral vessels were removed
